Reviews.Title: “Too far off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: POrchards
Reviews.Content: We three travellers had moderate expectations we were sadly disappointed. The hotel is tired and the rooms are very small if you do choose to book there ask for a room only on the first floor as the second floor ceilings are very low and clostophobic. There is no lift to help with luggage and the reception personnel are less than helpful. You even have to pay for a map of the city. No where else in Italy have we had to do that. However we loved Cenice and if possible we would recommend you stay around St Marks Square or the Rialto area. We will one day go back to Venice it is an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time @ Tre Archi”
Reviews.Author: Kathy A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tre Archi for 2 nights in late Feb. We had read that Venice hotels are usually dark and dank so didn't expect much. We had a room on the second floor (yes, you do have to climb several flights of stairs) and walked into a beautiful light airy room with more space than either the Rome or Florence hotels in which we had stayed. Our room looked out onto the canal and we had fun watching the traffic early in the morning. If you wanted to look disparagingly at the room, yes, the walls were dingy but they were cloth - not wallpaper - and the furnishings were an 18th century style with beautiful old Murano style chandeliers. We thought it all very charming. The bathroom had hot water and great water pressure and the 6'8" person was able to shower without being cramped. It was a quiet neighborhood and the walk to the vaporetti and Grand Canal was only 5 minutes. Breakfast had all the coffee we wanted and a great Italian sweet bread (as well as other rolls and cereal). It doesn't seem that Italian continental breakfasts are anything but coffee and bread from our experiences. If you want more, go buy something else at the markets nearby. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our flight from Marco Polo was at 6:30 am so we hired a private water taxi to take us there. From the hotel to the airport was less than 15 minutes. Expensive but worth it at that time of day. We will be happy to stay at Tre Archi in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Non touristy area”
Reviews.Author: eaudykes
Reviews.Content: We went for a few days in January when it was really cold but so atmospheric! Also there were no queues even at the most popular tourist venues. The hourly boat service from the airport is more expensive than the bus but drops you at the next stop after the hotel, Guglie. If you get the vaporetto at the stop outside you need to change to get to the Piazza San Marco area. The routes are a bit variable in the winter. The hotel was OK. The rooms weren't big but were warm and comfortable. There was no lift and no help with our suitcase though we are in our 60's. It was 56 stairs up to our floor. There was help for the young women, however! The breakfast was good, plentiful buffet style and never crowded. We liked the area. It wasn't too touristy.There was a good local shop just round the corner. Also there was an excellent shopping street with a market that went on till about 8 pm. This was not far and on the way towards the centre so we went there often. There was even a shop where all jumpers and tops were E10, coats E20!

Reviews.Title: “Be open minded and you'll enjoy this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SysCntrSpartan
Reviews.Content: If you fly into the Marco Polo Venice airport, take a bus into Venice -- it is very cheap and much faster than taking a vaporetto. Then you can take a vaporetto to this hotel, take the one that lists the Tre Archi stop -- the hotel is right there when you get off the vaporetto. I would suggest getting a 24 hr vaporetto pass. Upon walking in, you will notice that it is an older hotel (like most in Venice) and that you will be required to pay a VAT (city tax or value added tax) for each night you stay there. The room we stayed in was on the first floor, which mean it is actually on the second floor... We had a nice few from the back of the hotel and it was very quiet. It was mentioned before that the breakfast was lacking any type of meat(s), but this is typical for Italy, bread with some cheese or butter spread is the norm. Here are a couple of recommendations when traveling to this hotel: 1) Bring your own bar of soap as the soap provided is a packet of liquid. 2) Bring your own shampoo and/or conditioner, what the hotel provides is not enough. 3) Understand that this is an older hotel and it may or may not have a bath tub -- our room did, but it didn't have a shower curtain, but a clear and moveable pane of plastic that really didn't keep the water in the tub. 4) Bring water back with you at the end of the day as I didn't see or find a vending machine to purchase water. 5) There is wifi access in the lobby only and it is quite expensive, I would walk down a bit and goto MQ10 -- it is a cafe with free wifi. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cheap, affordable hotel. It was easy to get to, the staff was friendly and it was relatively close to everything -- remember, you can walk just about anywhere on Venice in 30 minutes or less. Lastly, I stayed there November 29th - 30th and the weather in Venice was very comfortable (cool at night) and it was not crowded at all...

Reviews.Title: “Family holidays”
Reviews.Author: SABDoha
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old, but having somegreat advantages, -chhose the room between 1st and 2nd floor, not remembering the room no but this room having a big beautiful bathroom, two small bedroom as privacy with young children and best part is facing the river --water taxi stand is just opposite the hotel,so easy access --venice market is on your foot from here & can be started from this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good”
Reviews.Author: MeathCo_Meath
Reviews.Content: Stayed 16th October for two nights, and was worried after reading the other reviews. But it was fine, canal view room with beautiful sunlight streaming into it, good size room, clean and bright. The bathroom might have been small and compact, but clean too, also plenty of hot water, and a hot towel rail on 24/7. The breakfasts were a little on the light side, nothing much to eat, only cereal that wasnt particularly nice. But fresh croissants and rolls, and as much tea / coffee as you could drink. There was an older gent on the desk, who was very nice, gave us directions and took our photo for us. The hotel is near to the Ferrovia boat terminal which was only about 10 mins away, and this brought you to San marco and Peggy Guiggenhem Museum also the Rialto bridge. There were lovely places to eat over the bridge, and lots of shopping if you turn left before the bridge. All in all we had a ball, and would recommend the hotel, cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful”
Reviews.Author: vegebrarian
Reviews.Content: Terrible customer service (didn't bring up our bags when they said they would, didn't say hello or goodbye when we were checking out), no elevator, breakfast hours were too early and short, mosquitoes/flies in the room that I think were coming from a drain in the bathroom, dirty wall paper, dirty duvet, instead of getting two twins we got one king size bed and location (15 minute walk to train station) was not that convenient since it was quite far from most of the popular sites.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: nohoannie
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom was really tiny, even by European standards. In fact, we went on to a cruise, and our stateroom on the ship was bigger than this room. Our room was up several flights of stairs, and there is no elevator. The breakfast room was cute, but the breakfast offerings were really minimal-like coffee and rolls - period. One of the desk clerks was pretty unfriendly, although another was fine. We've stayed in Venice at least half a dozen times, and in similarly priced hotels; this was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: madnessandpetals
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny. Service was terrible. Luggage storage pre check-in was not secure. Numerous flights of stairs. Couldn't sleep due to couple next door having a "great time" (thin walls). Had previously stayed at a two star hotel in Santa Croce which was much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but left disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Loybus
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a healthy walking distance from the train station. Did it with luggage - but acceptable. Quiet area. Had quad room that reminded us of a doll house. Sparse furnishings. On 3rd floor but only had ceiling windows so no view and didn't trust to keep them open with birds, etc. No lift so it was hard to get luggage to room - clerk did carry our heaviest bag. Small bathroom and almost unusable shower due to small size. Stayed 2 nights and left tired and unimpressed. Paid 300EUR for Sat night, and 190EUR for Sun night - after stay certainly felt it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Tour Agency from Hell!”
Reviews.Author: profabbott
Reviews.Content: We had planned a trip through Italy from Milan to Rome. We made all of our arrangements for trains and hotels totally alone on the Internet. After going from London to Paris to Milan to Verona, we decided to continue our tour with the GATE 1 travel program from Venice to Florence to Rome. Our first stop was the HOTEL TRE ARCHI in Venice. This was an alternative in their tour plan for us to get ONLY train tickets and hotels. We naively expected that they would at least give us information such as tour and dining options when we arrived as well as let us know where the official tour group was going even though we did not sign up for that. We paid about $2,000 (now about 4,000 Euros) for this limited service. In retrospect, this was a scam and a ripoff. We received nothing more than train tickets and hotel rooms! We could have done that ourselves. We expected some kind of services for our money, since we were supposed to be following this specific tour group on the same trains and hotels. We never met anyone from GATE 1, including any people on the tour that began in Venice on May 24. We stayed at a hotel that they recommended in Venice. It was the Hotel Tre Archi, which was a disaster from the moment we walked in at mid-afternoon after taking a private water taxi from the Train Station, which cost an outrageous $100. But, we had no alternative without any idea where we were going in the maze of waterways. Maybe we could have received directions on how to get to the hotel on a public boat from GATE 1. They gave us nothing but a receipt for the hotel with the address. No one at the station could help us. The young woman at the counter was totally bored and little help. She told us the room was on the first floor. But, in Venice the first floor is about the third floor, probably because of flooding. She told us to go up the stairs since there was NO ELEVATOR and no porter to help. Why is that in an upscale hotel recommended by GATE 1? They should know what FIRST FLOOR means there. As senior citizens, it was no fun dragging heavy suitcases up two flights of stairs. The girl should have told us to leave the bags when a porter comes at 8PM. We were in no rush to have our bags at that time. When we got to the room, there were no TV controls. The girl at the front desk had forgotten to give them to us from our key box. Duhhh! That's the first time they were never in a room when we arrived--even cheap motels.

Reviews.Title: “To little too late”
Reviews.Author: lhmLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, woman at reception was doing something at the desk and barely acknowledged our arrival. Was told that there was no one available to help with luggage. Our room was on the "first floor" but was 2 flights up. Someone would have been available later in the day, but she never told us. Recommended a restaurant, but neglected to tell us that we needed reservations. Decided to check out early because of the difficulty of reaching our room. Clerk the next day was very friendly and helpful. Offered to arrange tours, etc. but it was too late. Hotels that deal with tourists should realize the importance of first impressions.

Reviews.Title: “All I needed, for a good price”
Reviews.Author: AAflyer_nj
Reviews.Content: The Tre Archi Hotel is about as far from San Marcos Square as you can get, and still be on the island, but that's what makes it such a good choice, in my opinion. It's fairly near the train station, has a convenient "bus stop" (water-bourne bus) directly at it's front door, but you can walk to it in about 10-15 minutes. I arrived without a reservation and asked about a room for one night. Franco, behind the desk, was courteous and showed me up one flight of stairs to a room with a balcony overlooking the canal, with queen bed, & private bath for which he quoted 50 Euro including breakfast. I asked if WiFi was included, and he said they usually charged 4 Euro/2 hours, but he'd throw it in for free. After having just looked at a couple of other nearby 3-star hotels which offered less, for more $$$, I said, SOLD. The floors are marble, and the 10-foot high walls are covered in fabric neatly trimmed with cording. The entire hotel is clean, and seemed well maintained. I was there at the 'shoulder season' so you should not expect this price to be available during the summer. Also, because it was not yet summer-time, the central air-conditioning was not available, but thanks to it's thick walls, and cool marble floors, this was not a problem for me in early April. The staff was nice, and later that evening, the night clerk, Calub, was very responsive to my request for some ice and graciously lent me his lighter when I asked for some matches. The WiFi had good speed, and I was able to Skype outside by the canal while I enjoyed a beverage and cigar. Contrary to some other posts, I found the breakfast more than satisfactory; three varieties of dry cereals, coffee cake, croissants dusted with sugar, yogurt, rolls with your choice of 'spreadables; butter, honey, jelly, cream cheese, and wedges of soft cheese. The waitress will serve any type of coffee you want; cappuccino, American coffee, or espresso, and there is an orange juice machine, and tea bags. I have only a couple of CONS for this hotel; The TV in the room was small and did not have a remote control. However, this turned out to be a small problem as only 3 channels ( 2 Italian, 1 German) were available. The other, is that there is a certain amount of noise associated with overlooking a canal, as the canals serve as the streets in Venice. The "bus stop" in front brought with it the noise of the boats coming and going at the dock until about 11 pm, and in the morning you can hear the city getting to work, as the boats motor by below bringing cargo and supplies from the mainland. Even the garbage trucks are boats. The good news is that the thick walls and double pane glazing in the tight-fitting balcony doors will effectively block this noise, if you close them. After looking at my pictures of the front of the hotel, it appears that my room, Room 118, is the only one with a true balcony. The CONs are minor, and are easily overshadowed by the PROs.

Reviews.Title: “The break fast was absolute rubbish! Jut toast and butter with cereal and coffee. No eggs/bacon saussages...”
Reviews.Author: marlonUK
Reviews.Content: The breakfast that was offered was rubbish. Ther was no eggs no toast no saussages no cereal. just awful! Good for prisoners.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and easy to find and that is a plus!”
Reviews.Author: princessrenee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so easy to find and that is a huge plus for Venice been such a maze. We caught a boat from the train station and 3 stops later the hotel was directly in front of our stop. Perfect. The hotel itself is nice. Our room was gorgeous, split level with old fashioned furniture and very Venetian. The only thing I must say that it was hard to control the heating in our room, it was too hot. The breakfast was fine but very limited. The last day I think they were slack in replacing the food but it was ok. A great hotel and great location. Staff were friendly and well Venice is always beautiful even this been my 4th visit to this amazing city. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the Price”
Reviews.Author: pjsubway
Reviews.Content: This hotel might not be for everyone, but the value for the price was fine. It is close enough to the main attractions to be convenient, but it's not exactly in the middle of the action. There is a vaporetto stop in front of the hotel, which helps. The rooms are very clean, although not very attractive. The bathroom was spotless, but the shower was not exactly easy to use, with water getting everywhere. The beds weren't very comfortable, either, but not the worst. Breakfast was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Just enough off the beaten path for privacy but still close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: shrmnr
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is very nice and affordable in the generally overpriced city of Venice. If you arrive by train I suggest the water bus...a water taxi is just too expensive no matter where you go. There's a water bus stop right in front of hotel. The rooms were actually very large and roomy as were the bathrooms...very odd for budget European travel. We only stayed two nights but never saw anything to cause us to complain. Room was clean, linens were changed, lobby & breakfast area were nice & maintained. You will initially think you are far from everything but given that Venice defines the term "walking distance" you really aren't that far from restaurants, cafes, bars, shopping. You never have to worry about crime in Venice so it's not like this is a concern when wakling to/from the hotel at night. I recommend this place highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on Quiet Street within Easy Walking Distance to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: Danyelli
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel situated on a quiet street. I was worried it would seem too far out of the way but it actually was a short walk from the action and fairly close to the train station (about 10 minutes). Our room (#110) appeared to be unique as it was two floors with the bed on the top floor and sitting room on the main floor. We also had a shared balcony overlooking the garden. The problem is the upstairs bedroom was unbearably hot. Even with the heat turned off and the windows left open we had a hard time getting to sleep and this was in November! The walls were also very thin. You could hear every door slamming and the clack-clack-clack of heels and shoes in the hallway. The bathroom was nice (finally, no tiny shower stall!) but the tub mechanics made it difficult to shower. The shower head sprayed water awkwardly which left a mess of water everywhere. Water temperature was also sketchy (fine one day, barely warm the next). Additionally, our TV didn't work. Not a huge issue --we mostly like to turn it on for some background noise or to listen to some music. As a side note we did *not* mention the issue to the front desk so no word on how they would have responded. Breakfast was weak. A few hard rolls and some jelly. Cereal was also available but the only "milk" option appeared to be half and half (or was that whole milk?!). Even with all the negatives it was still a decent hotel. The decoration and style gave it Venetian charm and the location was convenient. I read comments about hotel staff being rude and I did not experience that although no was openly friendly --i.e. when you walk in the door no one greets you or acknowledges you on the way out in the morning. More importantly, when we needed help the front desk attendant always tried to help us which was helpful when we needed directions or advice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the overpriced Venice”
Reviews.Author: Aleks21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week ( June 2009 ) and it was great! Room was clean and good sized. It has all amenities like minibar, hair drier, AC, safe and TV. For the price we paid it was an amazing value comparing with other prices in Venice. Hotel is centrally located, it's about 10minutes walk from the central train station and about 15 from the bus station. The Vaparetto stop is just in front of the main hotel entrance and it's called Tre Archi ( 4 steps and you are in! ) The pleasant surprice was the staff attitude! All very polite, speaking reasonable English and very friendly! Breakfast was typical for Italy - pastries, jam, marmelade, soft cheese and coffee! Everything fresh! No fruits though. The only suggestion for the hotel management is that they could put more tables to the garden during the breakfast, not just 3. As the weather was brilliant! There are luggage storage facilities for your convenience and also the room was cleaned every day and towels were changed without asking! Nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “ALL TRAVELERS BE WARNED”
Reviews.Author: gypsytraveler325
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I have just returned from Venice and we feel that anyone considering this hotel needs to know what happened to us. Avoid this hotel at all cost. The desk clerks were rude to patrons, they can not seem to get stories together, one said the Air conditoner was turned off due to cold weather, the next morning after sleeping on the floor to stay cool we were told the AC doesnt work at all. THE MAIN CONCERN IS THE MAIDS WENT THRU ALL OF OUR LUGGAGE. DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING OF VALUE IN YOUR ROOM IF YOU STAY HERE.When I confronted the management nothing was done and no apology of any kind. We left early for safety issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Venice Visit”
Reviews.Author: 1vol
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right on the canal. A bit out of the way but a nice area close to good restaurants and shopping. Staff was very helpful. Nice European breakfast. A little noise from the boat landing in front of the hotel. An easy 10 minute walk from the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a canale”
Reviews.Author: sups-mus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tre Archi is suited at the Canale di Cannaregio, and it has a vaporetto station directly in front of its door. So you can go around in Venice using the vaporetti. The next station fo the Alilaguna boat from Venice airport is about 400 meters at Guglie, so travellers arriving by plane find an easy way to this hotel. We had a well suited room with air condition, a comfortable bathroom and got a breakfast very good for Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a miss”
Reviews.Author: Dustin8
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and stayed at Hotel Te Archi in early July. Our allocated rooms were on the third floor which comprises two rooms only, and in the roofline. As other reviewers have suggested the reception staff are far from helpful. We had to carry our luggage up four flights of narrow stairs and there was no offer to help. Same on checkout. The rooms were clean but have very limited ceiling height at entry. The room to the right of the stairs has canal views from a small window. The other room has no view whatsoever. The bathrooms are typical of hotels in Italy, very small especially the shower space. There was absolutely no hot water available in one room and the water pressure in both rooms was minimal. Both rooms has sewerage smells in the bathrooms. Breakfast was actually quite decent and the location is good being close to ferry stops and the train station. There is ample local dining choices. The hotel really needs to lift its game on service and fix the issues that are very evident with the plumbing and lack of hot water supply. If your tall and are allocated rooms 311 and 312 god help you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vivich
Reviews.Content: We spend a very nice stay in this hotel. Our room was clean and quiet. When we arrived, there were only 2 beds in the room whereas we were 3 and they immediatly add another bed. The room had a great balcony with a view on the garden. The breakfast was hearty but not really original. The only thing I can criticize is the fact that the hotel is far from the heart of Venice but it's not a real big deal because we can easily visit the town by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: weezworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tre Archi for a two night city break. The hotel is located in the Canareggio area and the location is excellent. The hotel overlooks the canal and is in a quiet area. There are restaurants within minutes and they are not overpriced like those around the busier tourist areas. The hotel is about 10-15 minutes walk from the bus station and there is a water bus stop right outside the hotel. (A number 41, 42, 51 or 52 stops at either the stop right outside the hotel or the stop just across the canal.) The hotel itself is very Venetian in it's decor. It has chandeliers, fussy wall coverings and furniture and is pretty much in keeping with what you would expect to find in Venice. The bathroom was clean and tidy, although the shower didn't work properly so you had to use the hand held shower. The hotel and room were very clean and if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a nice location then this one is for you. We walked to St Marks square and it took about 15 minutes (and was quicker than the water bus). We would use this hotel again-don't expect luxury but you can expect clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwanseaClairew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set slightly away from main tourist attractions, but all can be easily reached by foot or water taxi. We arrived late at night and got a water taxi and there is a stop directly outside the hotel which is very useful. The rooms were clean and typical venician style, cintinental breakfast was included which was basic but good. Brilliant hotel staff helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good for the 'get up & go' traveller”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler07960
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - directly in front of a vaporetto stop and on the other side of another one close by. We arrived at the hotel and, in agreement with other reviewers, felt that the person at the front desk lacked enthusiasm or, at the very least a smile - but no big deal. We were given room 120, which was in between the 1st and 2nd floor - too hard to explain. The room was nice - a room with a double bed and fridge and a smaller room with a single bed and desk. We used the single bed to place our suit cases, jackets, etc. The ceiling was low but it shouldn't be an issue for anyone under 6'6" The bathroom had double sinks and was nice. No elevator so be prepared to carry the luggage - no one offered to help. The breakfast is not good but, from talking to others, it is standard fair for hotels in Italy (perhaps the 5* ones are better). Walk to the local supermarket in the morning and grab something there. The hotel is on the border of the old ghetto which makes for a lovely place to walk and see where the Venetians live. It is also where the more affordable restaurants are. The location, away from the Grand Canal and main stops means it is quiet at night but it can take a while to get back there by vaporetto after 11 PM (that is when the express vaporetto stops and you have to take the local). You can walk to St. Marks in 15 - 20 minutes and it is a very enjoyable walk. Our only issue with the room was the shower or lack of a shower. The bathroom has a tub a glass partition that is hinged to the wall and swings - this is done to create a wall when showering. However, the tub did not have a hook to place the shower handle high enough to use the tub as a shower. The only hook was by the faucet of the tub. I had to stand holding the handle above by wife so she could shower. I mentioned it to the desk person and he said he would look at it - of course, nothing happened. The next day (before our last night), I mentioned to another clerk who must be the manager because he was generally concerned and asked to see the problem. I explained how to fix - was it ever done - who knows? It is a warm, clean, safe, and convenient place to sleep. The location in front of the bus stop makes it convenient as does the proximity to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Patty10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a wonderful surprise. The location was great. Close to the train station, and the public boat transportation stopped right in front of the hotel. The rooms were full of charm, and very clean. The hotel staff went above and beyond in helping us with all of our needs. A special thank you to " Maitta " who made our stay unforgetable. You cant go wrong if you chose this hotel. It has all of the charm of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “In decline”
Reviews.Author: ajmcgLeeds_UK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, first in 2003 and then in 2005. In 2003 I had an excellent stay, with the staff being extremely friendly and helpful. That and the location made it my choice for my next visit. In 2005 however, the original owners had retired and handed it over to their son, who, to be candid, just doesn't take the same pride in the work. I'd booked a specific room, and confirmed it the week before. On arrival I found someone else was in it, and I'd been placed in the attic, which by the way doesn't comply with Italian laws for this grade of hotel in terms of the electrics, warning notices or the sloping ceilings. (The owners had previously used these two rooms, but the new owner turned them into bedrooms.) I finally got the room I wanted two days later, but not one word of apology. Most of the staff were still as friendly, and, or course, the brilliant location hadn't changed, and the building itself can't help but have a certain elegance, being a former palazetto. I also got someone to carry my bags, but only after asking and explaining that I have a disability; and it was done with a bad grace. So it was a mixed experience; what had been a charming hotel was now no more than just about average. You could do worse, but you can certainly find better.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a friendly area”
Reviews.Author: Flimo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very handy location, right next to a vaporetto stop and five minutes walk from the stop that takes you straight back to the airport. The hotel is in the ghetto area, a very interesting and non-touristy part of venice, about 20 minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge. There is a handy english speaking newsagent shop nearby, as well as some nice bars and restaurants. The hotel is clean and decorated in Venitian style, with some amazing light fittings and mirrors in the lobby. The room and bathroom were clean (ours had a nice view of the canal). If you want to use the shower at peak times then you need to be patient and wait for the water to come out fast and hot. The breakfast available includes cereal, yoghurt, coffee or cappucino, orange or pineapple juice, rolls, sweet pastry, and a choice of jams/philadelphia cheese. The staff are helpful and patient and can book a private water taxi back to the airport (a great experience! It cost 120 euros when we were there). They speak english and are tolerant of your attempts to speak Italian. We would definitely go back and believe it was good value for money, especially when Venice is such an expensive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The flooded bathroom”
Reviews.Author: amber28
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel Tre Archi in Venice. We really liked the location of the hotel as it is away from the immense crowds near St Marks square. We also found the prices of food, coffee and gelati to be much more reasonable in the Cannaregio district and it is close to the train station. The walk to St Marks square was easy and the main route lined with shops. Unfortunately I wouldn't rate the hotel above a two star. Our room was very small. Our travelling companions were in a much better room, which had the bedroom on a mezzanine floor, giving an area to put suitcases. Our main problem was that water leaked out of the wall every time we had a shower. This wasn't just a small leak and the floor was completely immersed after a quick shower. When we asked for extra towels to soak up the excess we were dismissed and told it would be fixed. This never happened and we never got any extra towels. Breakfast was only average, but we soon learned this is pretty much par for the course in Italy. We probably wouldn't stay there again, but it did seem difficult to find accommodation in Venice. I know our agent had tried a few places before this one. I think if we hadn't had the leak or had had the problem addressed we would be more favourable towards Tre Archi.

Reviews.Title: “Improvements needed at the Tre Archi”
Reviews.Author: DiligentBen
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday, 20.09.2007. Initial impression was unfriendly staff; this continued for the most part of our four day stay, for example, no-one offered to help carry our heavy luggage up six flights of stairs (no lift) to our attic room. The room had skylight windows, no views and a sloping roof, which meant one had to stoop to negotiate movement in the room. No-one suggested that one could have a remote for the TV, so when we asked we were offered one for a 25 euro deposit. The shower was barely big enough to turn in, and the water ran from hot to cold throughout the shower, sometimes at a trickle. Breakfast was very poor - one of us asked for cold milk on the second day because the option was hot milk or cream the previous day - we were still brought hot, frothy milk, but this time cold frothy coffee, which was of poor quality anyway. On day three, the usual lack of initiative of the staff meant we were not offered any coffee but, having experienced three days of very little choice and slow service we decided to pass on this - we had already decided to get our own breakfast items from the Billa Supermarket, such was the poor selection available. Overall, we should not recommend this hotel to any other traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful canal view”
Reviews.Author: ivanoj
Reviews.Content: perfect location for the visit of venise next to the vapporetto. Nice and beautiful charming room with canal view, the breakfast is simple and nice with a charming garden for the nice season

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad, bad”
Reviews.Author: zapata476
Reviews.Content: Got there a little early for check-in, about an hour o so. Was told to leave the luggage in deposit, one floor below the reception area. No elevator and no help to carry the luggage. (Hu?) The room was on the second floor. Again, no help. The guy looked but made absolutely no effort. Toilet stopped up on the second day. It's hard to believe, but no plunger!!!!!. Breakfast consisted of some cheese, yogurt and a few pastries. Of course, coffee. Want my advise? Stay as far away as you can from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: AmosC
Reviews.Content: I was not very impressed with this hotel. It was advertised to us as 3 star accommodation, maybe this is the case in Italy but i would rate it as a 2 star (possibly less) here. Summary of bad points; No lift - i never use a lift anyway but..... to expect someone to lug a heavy suitcase all the way to the 2nd floor, i feel is a little unreasonable. Staff - made few attempts to talk in english, and i dont understand much italian. Room (210) - was so small, there was just enough room to walk around the bed, i know that the room is just there to sleep in but it would have been nice to be able to get my suitcase under the bed! (also, the fridge in our room did not work and when we asked for it to be fixed they told us to go out for a while and by the time we got back it would be mended. It was not, and never did get looked at the whole time we were there. Although our room was cleaned, the dust under the bed confirmed that it was not done properly. Bathroom - had a nasty smell to it, i suspect this was the sewer system, but still, not very nice. Also, the water was only sometimes hot, the rest of the time it was just warm. Hotel bar - we borrowed 2 glasses from the bar for a bottle of wine we brought with us, the bar only 3 had wine glasses in total (none of them matching) and no ice (a bit dissappointing as our fridge did not work either) Hotel web site - this really annoyed me. The web site gives information on how to get to the hotel. It obviously needs to be updated. We got a taxi from the airport (Treviso) to Piazzale Roma which cost 75 euros, i wouldnt have minded so much if the web site had not advised it would cost approx 25. Also the AVTO bus back to the airport costs 5 euros 1 way not 3 as suggested by the hotels web site. Breakfast - soggy cereal, jam, dairylee cheese triangles, melba toast and yoghurt, in my opinion, does not constitute a 'continental' breakfast. Summary of good points; Comfy bed. Clean towels. Warm and dry. Would i stay there again? Um, let me think about this one.........................................No. I will also be contacting the travel agent that sent us there telling us confidently that it was an 'outstanding' 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value but only just!”
Reviews.Author: JOJO97
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close by to shops and restaurants and very easy to get to thanks to the vaporetto stop that is right outside. We found all the staff really friendly and helpfull and would always speak and answered all our questions fully. The only draw backs to this hotel were the amount of stairs and no lift. We are both fit but after running up and down those stairs a few times i was sick of them!!! Also the room we stayed in was small and the wall covering was going mouldy. I would stay here again if i was looking for a bargain room.

Reviews.Title: “great for short term”
Reviews.Author: ravone
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice a day early and needed a hotel room for one night only while we waited for our apartment to be free. The Hotel Tre Archi is pretty much what you see in the photos. A quad room had two tiny single beds on a lower level and a larger double bed up a flight of stairs. Small. But the bath had hot water and clean towels and a good supply of soap, shampoo and even a shower cap. The room was very clean and quiet. They have a room to store your luggage before and after check-in/out times. A simple continental breakfast. The staff only spoke a little English, but I didn't find it to be a problem. They were very pleasant and helpful. I don't know if I would recommend this hotel for a long term stay as it is lacking in many luxuries that a bigger hotel might have. But for short term, it is in a non-touristy, quiet neighborhood free of crowds, yet close to a boat stop and only about a 10 minute walk to the train station. Try the Tre Archi Pizza restaurant on the opposite side of the canal from the hotel. It's a popular place & has outdoor tables overlooking the water. The staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had the hotel not had the convenience of two vaporetti stops (one right outside, the other just over the bridge) this would have been a major dissapointment. Unfortunately, I booked the hotel without first having read the reviews on this site - I wish I had. The girl who took the orders for coffe/tea at breakfast spoke only Italian, which I found most surprising given that it was a tourist hotel. My experience of Venice as a whole was that they really couldn't be bothered with the tourists as, like a vaporetto, another would be along shortly (there were a few exceptions but few and far between). This hotel came into that category, I'm sad to say. I had booked some time ago and asked for a canal-facing room as we were celebrating my birthday. As it was, we got put in the attic with views of the rooftops if you stood on tip-toe to look out of the skylight. Saying that, the room was quite spacious in comparrison to brief glimpses of others there. There was no hot water in the shower in the morning and even no water at all so we had to give up the idea of starting the day clean. There were no handtowels - instead you had napkins, or possibly tablecloths as they were slightly bigger! Breakfast was really poor. It's such a shame, given that they could do a lot more to make it a more attractive place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Tre Archi
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 923 | Ponte di Tre Archi, 30121 Venice, Italy
